citation.article-title: Aminomonas paucivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a mesophilic, anaerobic, amino-acid-utilizing bacterium.

p.s: Aminomonas (a.mi.no.mo'nas. M.L. aminum amine; Gr. n. monas a unit, monad; M.L. fem. n. Aminomonas amine-degrading monads)
In bacterial taxonomy, the epithet 'Amino-' has always been related to amino acid fermentation rather than amine utilization.
For the sake of clarity, it would be best if the epithet â€˜Amino-' is reserved for amino acids rather than being linked with amines.
Strictly anaerobic, non-spore-forming, mesophilic, curved rods.
Grows by utilizing amino acids only in the presence of yeast extract.
Forms a new line of descent in the low-G+C-containing branch adjacent to cluster V based on 16s rRNA sequence analysis.
Habitat: anaerobic sludge of a dairy wastewater treatment plant.
The type species is Aminomonas paucivorans.
